intro: Amphinomia, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe, Asia, and North America. Amphinomia species are typically shrubs or subshrubs with woody stems and showy, often pink or red, flowers. They are characterized by their small, fleshy leaves and their ability to thrive in rocky or well-drained soils. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
